item.title: Gears of War Series Gets Massive Player Count Boost
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gears of War: E-Day is a prequel, focusing on Marcus Fenix and Dom Santiago in the early days of the Locust invasion.
  • Gears of War titles have seen big player spikes after E-Day's reveal, with Gears of War: Ultimate Edition experiencing a 323% increase.
  • Gears 5's player count has also surged, surpassing popular titles like Call of Duty, likely due to the excitement around Gears of War: E-Day.

It seems more and more Xbox gamers are diving back into the Gears of War series, likely due to the swirling excitement surrounding The Coalition's recently revealed Gears of War: E-Day . Xbox just had what some are calling its best games showcase ever. New gameplay footage for big Xbox titles like Fable, South of Midnight, Perfect Dark, and State of Decay 3 was revealed, as well as an epic new Doom game named The Dark Ages . Even with all of this considered, Gears of War: E-Day arguably made the biggest splash of the show.

Many Gears of War fans were expecting to see a follow-up to 2019's Gears 5 when rumors began cropping up about a Coalition appearance at Xbox's showcase. Instead, longtime fans were pleased to learn that Gears of War: E-Day is a prequel to the main trilogy, set fourteen years before the events of the original game and focusing on Marcus Fenix and Dom Santiago as they struggle to survive the early days of the Locust invasion. The Coalition also expressed that Gears of War: E-Day will turn up the horror dial as it attempts to make Locust Drones, known as cannon fodder throughout the series, much more formidable and scary to face, as seen in the heavy-hitting reveal trailer.

Not even two weeks after Gears of War: E-Day 's reveal, TrueAchievements has reported that some Gears of War titles have seen massive player spikes following E-Day 's announcement. The title enjoying the largest jump is Gears of War: Ultimate Edition , the 2015 remaster of the original Gears game, which rose in players a whopping 323% according to TrueAchievements. This makes a ton of sense considering Gears of War: E-Day 's place in the franchise's timeline and its enticing promise to return to a more horror-heavy tone and setting akin to the earliest Gears games.

Gears of War: Ultimate Edition and Gears 5 Are Enjoying A Huge Jump In Player Counts

Players aren't just jumping into Gears of War: Ultimate Edition . Gears 5 has surprisingly seen a big player boost too, landing it on TrueAchievement's weekly top 40 chart at 34, over games like Call of Duty: Black Ops 2, Black Ops Cold War , and FIFA 23 . Though not as significant as Gears 5 or Ultimate Edition 's spikes, Gears of War 2 and Gears 3 enjoyed some extra attention as well. There's no doubt that these Gears of War player spikes are a direct result of The Coalition's Gears of War: E-Day reveal, which seems to have reignited the Gears fanbase, much like the Fallout Amazon series did to Bethesda's Fallout games a few months ago.

While it hasn't received an official release window, Gears of War: E-Day is rumored to be looking at a 2025 release. Though, considering Xbox already has Fable , Doom: The Dark Ages, and South of Midnight slated for next year, with inXile's Clockwork Revolution also rumored to join the party, it's easy to imagine Gears of War: E-Day coming out in 2026.

item.title: Helldivers 2's Leaked Illuminate Faction Raises One Big Gameplay Question
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Illuminate faction may make a big return in Helldivers 2, challenging players with their shields and psychic abilities.
  • Weapons with high rates of fire like assault rifles and shotguns are recommended for quickly taking down Illuminate shields.
  • Players may need to adapt their loadouts as the Illuminate could evolve to be immune to certain types of weaponry in this sequel.

Helldivers 2 being a sequel means there are many things from the previous game that could make a potential return. One of those things is enemies and those who have encountered the Illuminate are preparing for them to threaten Super Earth yet again. While implementing the Illuminate faction could expand Helldivers 2 in many ways, it also brings a question of significant importance.

New enemies are bound to make their way into Helldivers 2 , but the game has made it clear that the door is also open for old foes to reappear. Given the details provided by credible Helldivers leakers and the events leading to the destruction of Meridia, players may see the return of the Illuminate faction in a big way. Given the challenge they brought in the previous game, many will wonder what weapons have the potential of easily besting them upon their arrival. While Helldivers 2 has a multitude of equipment for dealing with a variety of enemies, figuring out which ones are effective against those with psychic abilities could eventually become a top priority.

Determining What Weapons Would Be Good Against the Illuminate

The arrival of a new foe means trying to understand what works well against them. One of the major things players should know about the Illuminate faction is that they are a race that's notorious for having shields. It allows them to attack boldly and removing their protective shell of defense requires proper commitment or else they regenerate. This means weapons with a high rate of fire would be useful as they will be responsible for quickly removing the shields, exposing the enemy to kill shots. Given the current equipment in Helldivers 2 , there are a few weapons that would make excellent candidates for Illuminate shield removal duty.

  • Assault rifles such as the AR-23 Liberator and AR-23P Liberator Penetrator
  • Submachine guns like the SMG-37 Defender and SMG-72 Pummeler
  • The SG-225 Breaker , SG-225IE Breaker Incendiary , and SG-225SP Breaker Spray&Pray shotguns
  • Energy weapons like the Las-5 Scythe and LAS-16 Sickle

While there is no guarantee that these weapons will work well in removing Illuminate defenses, they are some of the best options given what players know about the enemy from the previous game.

The Potential Changes to the Illuminate and What They Could Mean

Should the Illuminate return, it is likely that they will have modified their technology. This means that strategies that worked against them in the previous game may not be as effective now. Although Helldivers 2 has many amazing primary weapons and support equipment, figuring out which will work well against the potential new Illuminate requires a careful understanding of the enemy. They may have evolved to be immune to energy-based weaponry, meaning armaments such as the SG-8P Punisher Plasma or the powerful LAS-99 Quasar Cannon might do little to no damage. If that were to be the case, players who primarily use energy-based weapons would have to devise new loadouts that are best for dealing with the Illuminate's weaknesses.

With the likelihood of their shortcomings being the same as the previous game, weapons with high rates of fire will likely become the go-to for missions involving the highly sophisticated threat. The Illuminate could even lead to new major orders in Helldivers 2 that, upon completion, could potentially introduce a new Warbond specifically for going against the psychic-powered enemy faction. Such an update can be useful because it gives players more options while also cluing them in on what the enemy faction is truly weak against. This allows everyone to determine which of their current equipment will be the most useful against the Illuminate without spending on potential new weapons.

The arrival of a black hole after Meridia's destruction would make now a perfect time to introduce a new enemy faction in Helldivers 2 . The likelihood of it being the Illuminate is high and speculation about the enemy's potential new weaknesses will have players scrambling to figure them out. Although veterans from the previous game will have an idea of the best weapons for dealing with them, the developers can always surprise everyone by giving the Illuminate new shortcomings that nobody will expect.

item.title: Elden Ring: 16 Best Armor To Negate Lightning Damage & Where To Find Them
item.description:
Contrary to popular belief, lightning can strike twice in the same place, and in Elden Ring , it can strike much more than that, especially if the enemy is a cheating spammer like those late-game dragons. Against such enemies who are intent on turning the Tarnished into lightning rods, it helps to prepare some countermeasures, and armor stands out as the most accessible among these.

Not all armor in Elden Ring is protective, of course. In fact, one might even be surprised to learn that armor sets with the most metal parts tend to make for terrible lightning insulation. That kind of adherence to elementary-level science in Elden Ring doesn't bode well for players who want to protect themselves against one of the most troublesome damage types in the game. Thankfully, these armor sets are good exceptions.

Updated on June 20, 2024, by Vlad Mazanko: Lightning damage has always been one of the most dangerous types in Elden Ring. That's why lightning-resistant armor can be a literal life-saver, especially in late-game areas, where the game has more cruel surprises involving lightning. For instance, lightning resistance is reduced when characters are wet. Therefore, equipping the highest defense armors with good lightning resistance stats can be a crucial countermeasure in some of the game's more difficult regions. More armor with the highest lightning resistance has been added to the list to prepare players for the upcoming challenges of the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion.

16 Queen Of The Full Moon Set

Lightning Defense: 25.2

  • Location: Buy from Finger Reader Enia in the Roundtable Hold after defeating Rennala, the Queen of the Full Moon
  • Physical Defense: 11.5
  • Poise: 16
  • Weight: 11.0

The Queen of the Full Moon Set has a ridiculous headpiece and questionable physical defense, but all that is excused once players use it against mage enemies or dragons. The Queen of the Full Moon armor boasts one of the most consistently resistant stats in the game.

For that matter, it's no slouch when it comes to protecting its wearer against magic or elemental attacks. That said, players still shouldn't expect to poise through some of the toughest and heaviest lightning attacks in the game while wearing it. On the plus side, however, the armor's low weight can allow for some incredibly fast rolls.

15 Mushroom Set

Lightning Defense: 25.4

  • Location: Lake of Rot for the helmet, Seethewater Cave in Mt. Gelmir for the rest
  • Physical Defense: 12.5
  • Poise: 11
  • Weight: 12.1

Aside from its unforgettable looks, the Mushroom Set is also unique because its pieces are found separately in the game. Players will find the set's crown (or its pileus?) while exploring the Lake of Rot, on a corpse hanging off the top of a column. The rest of this unusual set can be found in Seethewater Cave in Mt. Gelmir, in a cavern with a Giant Poison Flower and multiple mushroom people.

The Mushroom Set is one of the greatest in the game in terms of various elemental and status effect resistances and is often used in some of Elden Ring 's most difficult areas, like the aforementioned Lake of Rot. Due to its very special looks, this armor is not too compatible with other sets in the game and is better used separately.

14 Noble's Set

Lightning Defense: 25.4

  • Location: East Windmill Pasture in Altus Plateau
  • Physical Defense: 11.9
  • Poise: 21
  • Weight: 14.0

As a light armor, the Noble's Set isn't too impressive in terms of Poise value or Physical defense, but it offers great lightning and magical defense and can be worn by almost any build with a limited equip load.

Another feature of the Noble's Set is that it can have headbands of different colors. The default blue Navy Hood is found with the rest of the set in East Windmill Pasture in Altus Plateau, in the fire in the middle of a circle of dancing Celebrants. For the Crimson Hood , earlier worn by Roderika, players need to complete her questline, unlocking spirit tuning in Roundtable Hold. After that, return to Stormveil Castle and search for this item atop the pile of bodies of Roderika's people, where the Chrysalids' Memento was initially found.

13 Beast Champion Set

Lightning Defense: 25.4

  • Location: Defeat Knight Bernahl in Crumbling Farum Azula near the Great Bridge site of grace
  • Physical Defense: 33.6
  • Poise: 72
  • Weight: 41.6

One NPC that players meet who decides to go rogue has one of the best armor sets in the game. The lucky imposing Recusant would be Knight Bernahl . He'll later invade players just before the final area boss arena in Crumbling Farum Azula

This is a rather important invasion as he'll drop a trick item to help with the boss. Along with that, he'll also drop his lovely armor set and his weapon. It's also advisable to fight Bernahl before fighting the Draconic Tree Sentinel guarding Maliketh's boss room because the Beast Champion Set he drops has good lightning resistance.

12 Preceptor's Set

Lightning Defense: 25.5

  • Location: Dropped by Seluvis after he dies in Seluvis' Rise in Liurnia of the Lakes, near the end of Ranni's questline
  • Physical Defense: 12.9
  • Poise: 27
  • Weight: 15.9

This witching set is initially worn by Preceptor Seluvis and can be retrieved following Ranni's questline if the Tarnished sides with her. At one point in the story, Seluvis will die and drop the full set in Seluvis's Rise, located in Liurnia of the Lakes.

The Preceptor's Set is a pretty good choice for any Intelligence build in Elden Ring , as it has a light weight and grants some of the best Lightning, Fire, and Magic damage resistances in the entire game. It also looks rather stylish, with its menacing mask and wide-brimmed hat, though it can hamper the player's view.

11 Scaled Set

Lightning Defense: 25.6

  • Location: Defeat Old Knight Istvan near the Limgrave Colosseum as part of the Volcano Manor contract quest
  • Physical Defense: 31.0
  • Poise: 71
  • Weight: 38

The Scaled Set is a great choice for mid-game melee builds, offering strong Poise, solid Physical defense, and robust Lightning damage negation. With its universal corroded metal look, players can also combine parts of this set with other similar armor in the game, creating a unique knightly appearance. As with most armor in Elden Ring , players can remove the armor's cape by altering the armaments at any Site of Grace.

To get the full Scaled Set, players need to accept the Volcano Manor assassination contract questline and then find and defeat Old Knight Istvan near the Limgrave Colosseum.

10 Lionel's Set

Lightning Defense: 25.6

  • Location: Lower Capital Church Site of Grace in Leyndell, Royal Capital
  • Physical Defense: 33.6
  • Poise: 86
  • Weight: 50.5

This heavy set is easy to obtain, and players don't need to fight or kill anyone to get it. It is simply discovered in Leyndell, Royal Capital, on the bed in the building with the Lower Capital Church Site of Grace.

Such armor is also worn by one of Fia's champions, but he doesn't drop this set after the fight. With its high weight, players should expect great Poise and Physical damage negation, and Lionel's Set doesn't disappoint. On top of that, it grants one of the best stats for lightning, fire, and magic defense, making it useful in various combat encounters.

9 Fire Prelate Set

Lightning Defense: 25.6

  • Location: Drops from Prelate enemies (Fort Laeidd in Mt. Gelmir or Guardians' Garrison in the Mountaintops of the Giants)
  • Physical Defense: 36.5
  • Poise: 96
  • Weight: 58.8

One of the heaviest armor sets in the game, the Fire Prelate Set grants almost unparalleled Poise and defense, not only against Physical damage but also against Lightning and Fire. It is one of the armors in Elden Ring that gives one's character an 'oversized' look.

To obtain the full Fire Prelate Set, players need to hunt for Prelate enemies in Elden Ring . It is recommended to boost one's Arcane stats for better results (players can use the Silver Tear Mask that increases Arcane by +8), or use the Silver Scarab Talisman or Silver-Pickled Fowl Foot . The best farming spots for this set are Fort Laeidd in Mt. Gelmir and Guardians' Garrison in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

8 Banished Knight Set

Lightning Defense: 25.6

  • Location: Drops from Banished Knight enemies (Stormveil Castle, Castle Sol)
  • Physical Defense: 35.6
  • Poise: 72
  • Weight: 41.6

The Banished Knight Set is a gift that keeps on giving in Elden Ring . Apart from having one of the most balanced and stylish designs in the game, it also boasts good lightning resistance, making it a well-rounded armor for all occasions. It's quite heavy, but that's a fair trade-off.

Acquiring it is the only difficult and daunting aspect of this armor. The parts randomly drop from Banished Knight enemies, so it might take several attempts and a few hours of trying to acquire the complete set unless players just ask for it from others online.

7 Ronin's Set

Lightning Defense: 25.7

  • Location: Kill Shabriri near Zamor Ruins site of grace in the Mountaintops of the Giants
  • Physical Defense: 21.3
  • Poise: 37
  • Weight: 21.1

Don't want to dress like a nun? Then the good news is that one of the most stylish armor sets in the game has impeccable lightning resistance. The Ronin's Set , which is worn by Bloody Finger Hunter Yura (and Shabriri later on), is the peak of Samurai aesthetics in Elden Ring . The flowy and battle-worn cloak as well as the Iron Kasa hat will surely turn heads in multiplayer.

Obtaining the Ronin's Set is sadly not possible during the early game. Players will have to finish Yura's questline or refrain from killing Yura themselves. Either of the two options will result in Shabriri possessing Yura and showing up later on in the Mountaintop of the Giants in the Zamor Ruins Site of Grace. Players can kill Shabriri here inconsequentially after talking to him and looting the armor from him.

6 Traveling Maiden Set

Lightning Defense: 25.8

  • Location: Shack of the Lofty on the frozen river in Mountaintops of the Giants
  • Physical Defense: 10.8
  • Poise: 21
  • Weight: 11

The Traveling Maiden Set is barely armor. In fact, it's just a nun's robe in Elden Ring since "maidens" are envoys of the Two Fingers. But when one is looking for a reliable way to stave off some lightning attacks, then the Traveling Maiden Set more than delivers. The cloth is probably padded with rubber.

Too bad players can't obtain it until they're in the late game, specifically in the Mountaintop of the Giants. This armor set can be located in the Shack of the Lofty. It's near the western end of the frozen river that flows from the big frozen lake. The trek there is pretty easy, though, and outside the shack is a good place to farm Runes.

5 Lusat's Set

Lightning Defense: 25.8

  • Location: Sellia Hideaway in Caelid after finishing Sellen's questline
  • Physical Defense: 15.0
  • Poise: 21
  • Weight: 14.3

Master Lusat has one of the most protective armor sets out of all the magic-focused apparel in Elden Ring . This protection trickled down to lightning, as it also has good lightning resistance on top of magic. It's mostly for Intelligence builds since Lusat's Glintstone Crown will increase the damage for Stars of Ruin , but anyone can wear it.

In order to obtain Lusat's Set , players will have to finish Sellen's questline. She's located in Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave. Sorceress Sellen will instruct players to find Master Lusat, who's imprisoned in the Sellia Hideaway in Caelid. It's due north of the Church of the Plague but can be accessed from Fort Faroth by dropping down south. Sellia Hideaway is hidden behind a fake cliff wall, which players need to hit to dispel.

4 Astrologer Set

Lightning Defense: 26.0

  • Location: Nomadic Merchant in Liurnia of the Lakes
  • Physical Defense: 13.0
  • Poise: 24
  • Weight: 13.3

It turns out that players don't have to look far in order to obtain a lightning-resistance armor set. The Astrologer Set is a starting armor in Elden Ring if players pick the Astrologer class. It's light and convenient for magic or Intelligence builds due to its high magical and elemental protection. Physical protection leaves much to be desired, however.

For those who didn't start with the Astrologer class but still want the Astrologer Set, the armor can be bought from Nomadic Merchant (North Liurna) . Players will be able to see the smoke from his bonfire from a good distance.

3 Malformed Dragon Set

Lightning Defense: 27.0

  • Location: Defeat Draconic Tree Sentinel in Crumbling Farum Azula just outside of Maliketh, the Black Blade boss arena
  • Physical Defense: 32.3
  • Poise : 67
  • Weight: 38

The Malformed Dragon Set is an intimidating collection of armor pieces, and as expected from its appearance, it offers great protection against lightning. It just so happens that a lot of dragons in Elden Ring 's late-game deal too much lightning damage too frequently, and this armor can prove incredibly useful in such scenarios.

It's only obtainable in a late-game area, in Crumbling Farum Azula, and players will have to fight and kill the Draconic Tree Sentinel (Capital Outskirts) in order to get it. It's a tough fight, but the reward is worth it, and the enemy doesn't respawn as it's just a mini-boss.

2 Omen Set

Lightning Defense: 29.0

  • Location: Finish Dung Eater's questline or kill him in his prison in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds at the Leyndell Royal Capital
  • Physical Defense: 35.0
  • Poise: 91
  • Weight: 55

It's heavy, it's unsightly, and it's probably caked in feces and blood since it belongs to Dung Eater , but one can't deny the effectiveness of his armor. It's one of the most protective sets in the game. The Omen Set boasts high physical protection and also good elemental defense.

Getting it is a little troublesome, but players can have it during mid-game. There are two methods of obtaining it, and both of them involve initiating Dung Eater's questline by giving him a Seedbed Curse . Players can find one of these Seedbed Curses in Leyndell, Royal Capital in an octagon tower after an elevator. One the item has been given to Dung Eater, he'll give the player the key to his prison. The prison can then be found in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds under Leyndell, Royal Capital. Players can kill Dung Eater right away for his armor and sword, but this will forfeit his quest. Finishing his quest by giving him five Seedbed Curses will still grant players the armor, but this approach can span up to late-game.

1 Bull-Goat Set

Lightning Defense: 29.0

  • Location: Defeat Great Horned Tragot in Magma Wyrm boss room in Ruin-Strewn Precipice (accept Patches' Volcano Manor quest first)
  • Physical Defense: 38.5
  • Poise: 100
  • Weight: 63

Statistically, this is the best armor set in Elden Ring . It's also the heaviest, which is a fair trade-off for something so defensively whole. This armor set has the highest Poise value in the game, as well as the best physical damage mitigation. It also has the best lightning resistance out of all armor.

Surprisingly, players can obtain it mid-game or even earlier. All they have to do is follow through with Patches (NPC) 's questline. The important part here is when he moves to Volcano Manor near the entrance hallway. Patches will give players an assassination letter where they'll have to kill Great Horned Tragoth . This Elden Ring NPC can only be accessed if players have killed Magma Wyrm Makar , who is located in the Ruin-Strewn Precipice (the northernmost tip of the lake in Liurnia of the Lakes). Once players have killed Makar or if they have killed Makar prior, they can simply go back to the creature's boss arena and Great Horned Tragoth's invasion sign should be visible on the floor. He'll drop the Bull-Goat Set when killed.

item.title: Why Mass Effect 4 Taking The Opposite Approach to Dragon Age: The Veilguard Would Be Ideal
item.description:
Highlights

  • Mass Effect 4 must differentiate from Dragon Age's party style to maintain unique gameplay experience and lore depth.
  • The Veilguard's focus on human characters may limit the diversity expected in a fantasy setting, sparking player concerns.
  • Mass Effect 4 can learn from past successes by expanding companions to include more diverse races, enhancing the galactic community.

With Mass Effect 4 confirmed to be in production for some time, it's safe to say that the development process and reception around Dragon Age: The Veilguard is highly likely to have an impact on the studio's next major sci-fi outing. In a genre known for how the distribution of party members can set the tone for an entire experience, it might be best for Mass Effect 4 to take a completely different route when compared to The Veilguard 's seemingly streamlined cast.

There are unlikely to be more concrete details arising about the next Mass Effect for a while given the entire hype and release cycle for The Veilguard which is brewing, with it even being possible that the studio is biding its time on ME . As the shift towards action and away from tactics has continued with each Dragon Age title, the next game is set to mirror Mass Effect more than ever by limiting the player to being accompanied by two party members who cannot be directly controlled. While this reflects an emphasis on intimacy when paired with the smaller number of characters, overall, it might be wise for Mass Effect 4 to diverge from this trend in one key way for the sake of its lore.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard's Companion Line-Up Appears to Lean into Depth Over Diversity

Humans Make Up Nearly Half of The Veilguard's Party So Far

With its characters being the main focus of the game's reveal trailer, The Veilguard 's seven companions and what groups they represent from throughout Thedas were some of the first details available upon announcement. Their racial distribution is the following:

  • Davrin – Elf Warrior
  • Taash – Qunari Warrior
  • Lace Harding – Dwarf Rogue
  • Lucanis Dellamorte – Human Rogue
  • Bellara – Elf Mage
  • Emmrich Volkarin – Human Mage
  • Neve Gallus – Human Mage

Varric doesn't even seem to be returning as a full companion despite his prominent role, so three of the seven revealed are humans. Origins featured five out of ten of its party as humans, while DA2 had six out of nine and Inquisition had four out of nine, so The Veilguard seems to be quite predictably following this pattern of ratio. When considering the expanded Tevinter setting of The Veilguard and the epic lore of Thedas that has been set up over the past few years, however, it's understandable that some players were instead expecting bolder representation of the world's fantasy races.

A Wider Scope for Mass Effect 4's Party Would Do Justice for Its Lore

The Potential to Fully Represent ME's Galactic Community in a New Generation

There are multiple races who have never been featured as companions despite their relevance in the galaxy, and the post-Reaper setting of Mass Effect 4 could be a great environment for leaning into those more novel species options. It could be argued that The Veilguard 's tighter set of more familiar demographics allowed for more exploration of each character, but repeating the same dynamic in the studio's next big release might leave fans feeling burnt out. It's a lot harder to imagine players expressing more enthusiasm about yet another human soldier in the next Mass Effect when the likes of Batarians, Vorcha, Volus, and even Hanar are still on the table.

Taking Inspiration from Mass Effect 2's Highs and Learning from Its Lows

It's seen by many as the peak of the trilogy overall, and Mass Effect 2 's massive party size has generally played a large role in that assessment. With 12 companions each featuring a unique loyalty-earning mission, their diversity shines through regardless of some being less developed. This number of characters inevitably led to some being lackluster, but attempting a similar, or even greater scale, moving forward would have the benefit of hindsight in that department and could help lay the foundation for a new era of Mass Effect .

item.title: Fae Farm Reveals Massive DLC Expansion
item.description:
Highlights

  • Explore the new realm of Skyvale in Fae Farm: Skies of Azoria, with magical creatures and exciting gameplay mechanics to uncover.
  • Master new skills, discover recipes, and collect unique resources in the DLC expansion, offering even more customization options.
  • Dive into the mystical atmosphere of Fae Farm, blending farming sim and RPG elements for a cozy yet thrilling gaming experience.

Phoenix Labs has unveiled a massive DLC expansion for the hit cozy farming sim Fae Farm , offering players an exciting new realm of magic and more to explore in Skies of Azoria . Fae Farm has been praised by audiences for its vibrant environment, satisfying gameplay, and expansive customization, and Skies of Azoria has even more excitement in store for fans of this popular title.

Providing a familiar yet unique take on farming life-sim video games, Fae Farm offers a colorful tale with a magical twist, taking players through quaint farms and mystical caverns on a whirlwind adventure of exploration. The second major update to Fae Farm , Skies of Azoria includes brand-new gameplay mechanics, even more characters, and an entire new realm for players to uncover.

Fae Farm developer Phoenix Labs has revealed an exciting trailer for its latest DLC expansion, Skies of Azoria , giving fans a glimpse into the new discoveries awaiting in this major addition to the beloved game. Skies of Azoria will take players to the three mystical regions of the new realm of Skyvale, where they will be able to master new skills, discover recipes and potions, and collect unique crops and resources. The DLC expansion will include a variety of new cosmetics and decorations, further expanding the already impressive customization features in Fae Farm . Skies of Azoria will also feature new romanceable characters and curious mysteries, offering up even more magical experiences than ever before. Whether jumping into Fae Farm for the first time or making an epic return to the realms of magic, Skies of Azoria has something special in store for everyone.

Fae Farm: Skies of Azoria - Launch Trailer

In the launch trailer for Fae Farm: Skies of Azoria , fans are treated to a sneak peek at the colorful new realm of Skyvale. Situated beautifully among billowing clouds, Skyvale is a mysterious celestial realm populated by winged denizens who can form platonic and romantic relationships with the player. Puzzling dungeons with precious rewards and unique resources await, with players able to discover Skyvale solo or with up to four players in online multiplayer or with local co-op via the Nintendo Switch ad-hoc wireless feature. With magical secrets waiting to be discovered, players can soar through Fae Farm: Skies of Azoria now on Nintendo Switch and PC.

From its cozy atmosphere to mystical thrills, Fae Farm continues to offer a refreshing balance of relaxation and excitement. Fans of farming games with combat may want to take a closer look at Fae Farm: Skies of Azoria and experience the magical wonders that await.
